meanings.definition: In a calm and self-possessed manner.
meanings.sent1: She walked composedly to the stage to give her speech.
meanings.sent2: He spoke composedly even in the face of criticism.
meanings.sent3: The cat sat composedly on the windowsill, watching the birds outside.
meanings.sent4: The old tree stood composedly in the midst of the storm, its branches swaying gently.
meanings.sent5: The teacher handled the disruptive students composedly, never losing her cool.

meanings.sent1: Her composedly expression calmed everyone in the room.
meanings.sent2: The composedly lake reflected the clear blue sky above.
meanings.sent3: The composedly cat napped peacefully in the sunbeam.
meanings.sent4: The composedly mountain stood tall against the horizon, unmoved by the passing clouds.
meanings.sent5: The composedly music filled the room, soothing all who listened.
